items.sentence: Tom asked Mary to repeat what she had just said.
Even the optimists agree that it won\'t be easy.
Everybody wants to know what\'s going to happen.
I just think you should be careful, that\'s all.
Does anybody here have an umbrella I can borrow?
I\'m going to be meeting Tom\'s parents tonight.
Why do you always have to overcomplicate things?
Tom asked Mary what she thought the problem was.
Tom hid behind a bush so Mary wouldn\'t see him.
All things considered, I\'d rather be in Boston.
Both Tom and Mary don\'t speak French very well.
Tom and Mary have stopped talking to each other.
Tom and Mary have the same color socks on today.
I take a walk before breakfast almost every day.
I want to know where I can buy a hat like yours.
Tom didn\'t look like he was having a good time.
Tom didn\'t mention where he was planning to go.
Tom didn\'t notice that Mary was staring at him.
I can\'t do that, not under these circumstances.
Where do you want to go on your summer vacation?
Which bottle of wine do you want to drink first?
How are we going to do this without Tom\'s help?
How did Tom know he wasn\'t supposed to do that?
I asked Tom to help me pull weeds in the garden.
You didn\'t want Tom to know the truth, did you?
Everyone knows Tom and I don\'t like each other.
Tom isn\'t really going to eat that frog, is he?
Why don\'t you ask Tom to introduce you to Mary?
Mary is Tom\'s daughter from his first marriage.
All the boys in Mary\'s class think she\'s cute.
Tom certainly knows what he should be doing now.
You should\'ve paid attention to Tom\'s warning.
Do you think Tom would\'ve wanted us to do that?
Tom asked Mary to stop doing what she was doing.
I just saw Tom entering the principal\'s office.
All of my children want to go to Boston with me.
I can\'t tell if you\'re being sarcastic or not.
When Tom entered the room, Mary stopped talking.
When did you notice that your umbrella was gone?
I asked Tom to help me clean up after the party.
Tom says that he\'s too busy to help Mary today.
I can show you around town if you\'d like me to.
I can swim now, but I couldn\'t three years ago.
I can\'t afford to buy the computer that I want.
The police searched Tom\'s room for three hours.
Tom has lived in Boston for quite some time now.
You\'re not supposed to wear lipstick at school.
Tom doesn\'t play tennis as often as he used to.
Tom and Mary were married for a very short time.
I\'m going to a conference in Boston next month.
